Package com.k2.Expressions.expression

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Expression<T>
    This interface defines the methods available on all Expressions Expressions provide an abstracted value derived from an Evaluator.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractExpression<T>
    This abstract class forms the basis of the Expression classes This class implemnts the hashCode() and equals(Object) methods using the name of the java type returned by the expression and the alias value returned by the getAlias() method.
    CurrentTime
    The CurrentTime class holds a date value set when the instance of CurrentValue is created an set to the current date and time This value is then used to derive the return values for the getDate(), getTime() and getTimestamp() methods.
    ExprAbsolute<N extends java.lang.Number>
    This implementation of the Expression interface provides implements an mathematical absolute method that returns the absolute value of the given numerical expression
    ExprAs<T>
    This implementation of the Expression interface casts the evaluated result of the source expression into the desired type
    ExprConcatenate
    This implementation of the Expression interface provides implements an concatenate method that returns the given values concatenated together
    ExprCurrentDate
    This implementation of the Expression interface provides the current date.
    ExprCurrentTime
    This implementation of the Expression interface provides the current time.
    ExprCurrentTimestamp
    This implementation of the Expression interface provides the current timestamp.
    ExprDifference<N extends java.lang.Number>
    The Difference expression calculates the difference between the two numerical arguments by subtracting the latter from the former.
    ExpressionBuilder
    The expression builder provides factory methods to create implementations of the Expression interface that provide known functions
    ExprLength
    The Length expression calculates the length in characters of a string
    ExprLiteral<T>
    The literal expression encapsulates a given literal value as an expression
    ExprLocate
    The locate expression identifies the location of one string within another
    ExprLower
    The lower expression converts a string into lower case
    ExprMod
    The mod expression provides the mathematical modulus function
    ExprNeg<N extends java.lang.Number>
    The negative expression returns the negative value of the numerical value it receives
    ExprNullIf<Y>
    The nullIf expression returns null if the first argument is null or the two arguments are equal, otherwise it returns the first value
    ExprNullLiteral<T>
    The null literal expression provides a typed null value
    ExprProd<N extends java.lang.Number>
    The product expression returns the product the two numbers passed to it
    ExprQuot
    The quotient expression calculates the quotient of two numbers
    ExprSqrt
    The square root expression calculates the square root of a numerical value
    ExprSubstring
    The substring expression extracts a substring from a given string
    ExprToBigDecimal
    The to big decimal expression converts the given numerical expression in to a BigDecimal
    ExprToBigInteger
    The to big integer expression converts the given numerical expression in to a BigInteger
    ExprToBoolean
    The to Boolean expression converts the given expression in to a Boolean expression
    ExprToDate
    The to Date expression converts the given expression in to a Date expression
    ExprToDouble
    The to Double expression converts the given expression in to a Double expression
    ExprToFloat
    The to Float expression converts the given expression in to a Float expression
    ExprToInteger
    The to Integer expression converts the given expression in to a Integer expression
    ExprToLong
    The to Long expression converts the given expression in to a Long expression
    ExprToString
    The to String expression converts the given expression in to a String expression
    ExprTrim
    The Trim expression trims leading and or trailing characters from a string
    ExprUpper
    The upper expression converts a string to upper case
    GetterExpression<E,T>
    The getter expression derives its value through the evaluator to supply a value for the given getter
    ParameterExpression<T>
    Parameter expressions derive their value from the parameters set on the evaluator
